title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0001
text: What is the primary characteristic of a shared database architecture in microservices?

options.text: Multiple services access the same database schema
Each service has its own independent database
Each service uses a different database technology

explanation: In a shared database architecture, multiple services access and manipulate data within the same database schema.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0002
text: Which of the following best describes the shared database pattern?

options.text: Multiple microservices share a single database for data consistency
Each microservice owns its own database
Services communicate only through message queues
Each service uses a separate schema in the same database

explanation: The shared database pattern allows multiple microservices to share a single database for data consistency and simplicity.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0003
text: What is a major drawback of using a shared database in microservices?
explanation: A shared database introduces tight coupling between services, making schema changes risky and coordination complex.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a common reason teams use a shared database?

options.text: To simplify data consistency across services

explanation: Teams often use a shared database to simplify data consistency and avoid duplication across services.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a risk of using a shared database?

options.text: Schema changes can break multiple services

explanation: Schema changes in a shared database can break multiple services that depend on the same tables.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a shared database?
explanation: A shared database simplifies data consistency and reporting since all services access the same data source.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in a shared database architecture?
explanation: Coordinating schema changes across multiple teams is a major challenge in a shared database setup.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a typical symptom of a shared database anti-pattern?

options.text: Frequent coordination between teams for schema updates

explanation: Frequent coordination for schema updates indicates tight coupling and dependency between services.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a common mitigation strategy for shared database coupling?

options.text: Introduce database views or APIs as access boundaries
Allow direct table access for all services
Use shared stored procedures for all logic
Centralize all business logic in the database

explanation: Using database views or APIs as access boundaries can reduce coupling between services sharing a database.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a major disadvantage of a shared database in microservices?
explanation: A shared database reduces service autonomy because services depend on a common schema and data model.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a common reason teams move away from a shared database?

options.text: To achieve independent deployments and scaling

explanation: Teams move away from shared databases to achieve independent deployments and scaling for each service.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a risk of shared database access?

options.text: One service can accidentally corrupt data used by another

explanation: When multiple services share a database, one service can accidentally corrupt or modify data used by another.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of a shared database for analytics?
explanation: A shared database provides centralized data access, making it easier to generate reports and analytics.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationSharedDatabase - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a common operational challenge with shared databases?

text: Which of the following is a common anti-pattern in microservices?

options.text: Multiple services sharing the same database schema
